conclusion: To determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side, we need to analyze the given velocity-time graphs for both cars.
At t=0, Car A is at position 0 and Car B is at position 40 m/s.
At t=10s, Car A has traveled 40 m/s for 10 s, reaching position 40 m/s.
At t=20s, Car A has traveled 40 m/s for 10 s, reaching position 80 m/s.
At t=30s, Car A has traveled 40 m/s for 10 s, reaching position 120 m/s.
At t=0, Car B is at position 40 m/s.
At t=10s, Car B has traveled 40 m/s for 10 s, reaching position 80 m/s.
At t=20s, Car B has traveled 40 m/s for 10 s, reaching position 120 m/s.
At t=30s, Car B has traveled 40 m/s for 10 s, reaching position 160 m/s.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B occurs when they are side by side at t=30s.
At t=30s, Car A has traveled 120 m/s for 10 s, reaching position 120 m/s.
At t=30s, Car B has traveled 160 m/s for 10 s, reaching position 160 m/s.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B is the distance between their final positions at t=30s, which is 160 m.
Therefore, the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side is 160 m.
